messages.subject: RE: [unschoolingbasics] Dinner party game
messages.msgSnippet: What no one daring enough to invite Q? But then he would all seven guests because he can t stand not to be the center of attention. Shannon
messages.messageBody:
What no one daring enough to invite Q? But then he would all seven guests
because he can't stand not to be the center of attention.

Shannon

Sent: Wednesday, January 25, 2006 6:18 PM
To: unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Dinner party game


On Jan 25, 2006, at 4:18 PM, Deb Lewis wrote:

> Worf!
>
> Deb, pant, pant, drool, drool...crashing Joyce's party...

Okay, we'll uninvite Spock and Seven of Nine. They probably wouldn't
be the life of the party anyway and you can come and bring Worf :-)

Of course if we wanted a fun dinner party we'd have to have Tom Paris
and Trip. I guess the guest list will need some work ;-)

Joyce

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Dinner party game
messages.msgSnippet: ... But wouldn t your husband be assumed to be included if you hosted a dinner? You wouldn t put him on the guest list! So you get to pick another one I think
messages.messageBody:
On Jan 25, 2006, at 2:50 PM, zenmomma@... wrote:

> I included my husband! If I got to talk to all those amazing people
> I'd want him in on the conversation so we could talk more about it
> later. :o)

But wouldn't your husband be assumed to be included if you hosted a
dinner? You wouldn't put him on the guest list! So you get to pick
another one I think :-)

While I'd be interested to listen in on lots of these parties it's
fictional characters I'd like to meet so I guess I can't play. But if
the rules were changed and I had to choose characters other than ones
I've created myself ;-) I'd probably fill a table from Star Trek :-)

Capt. Kirk
Mr. Spock
Capt. Picard
Data
Capt. Janeway
Seven of Nine
Jadzia Dax

Joyce

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Dinner party game
messages.msgSnippet: ... automatically be my first choice.:) I included my husband! If I got to talk to all those amazing people I d want him in on the conversation so we could
messages.messageBody:
>>I'm assuming it has to be people outside my family, because they'd
automatically be my first choice.:)>>

I included my husband! If I got to talk to all those amazing people I'd want him in on the conversation so we could talk more about it later. :o)

--
~Mary

"The miracle is not to walk on water. The miracle is to walk on the
green earth, dwelling deeply in the present moment and feeling truly
alive."
~Thich Nhat Hanh

messages.msgSnippet: ... very good ... Okay, where would you take them?  My wife and I are both cooks, though she is the one working outside the home right now. I add to my list of
messages.messageBody:
--- In unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com, "S Drag-teine"
<dragteine@s...> wrote:
>
> Ooh... I never even thought about what would I serve - I am not a
very good
> cook so we would probably have to go out to a restaurant.

Okay, where would you take them? My wife and I are both cooks, though
she is the one working outside the home right now.
I add to my list of why I homeschool the ability to go to restaurants
at their downtimes.

-----Original Message-----
From: unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com
[mailto:unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of sam
Sent: Wednesday, January 25, 2006 1:38 PM
To: unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [unschoolingbasics] Re: Dinner party game

I'm going to break down and participate. I did this about a week ago
on a punk parents group, but since then, and having read some posts
here, I may have to update my list a bit.
for now, we'll go with:
1. Joey Ramone
2. Mark Twain
3. Muhammad Ali
4. Philip Pullman
5. Ben Franklin
6. Louis L'Amour
7. Martin Luther King Jr.

My list is subject to change, and I'm only sorry that I had to include
only seven. I can only imagine the stress of actually having this
party, not even mentioning the problems inherent in resurecting the dead.
Now, what would you serve? I'd go with a big (big) breakfast, scones,
biscuits and gravy, sausage and bacon, scrambled eggs (with chipotle
cheddar cheese)lots of fruit, lots of coffee, bloody marys, pancakes
(the buttermilk recipe from Joy of Cooking)






Yahoo! Groups Links

Douglas Adams

John Cleese

Stephen Fry

And the two South Park writers - those guys are hysterical!

-pam

messages.subject: Dinner party game
messages.msgSnippet: This is hard....I ve swiped a name or two from most people s lists! I m assuming it has to be people outside my family, because they d automatically be my
messages.messageBody:
This is hard....I've swiped a name or two from most people's lists!
I'm assuming it has to be people outside my family, because they'd
automatically be my first choice.:)

1)Siddartha Guatama
2)Viggo Mortenson
3)Jesus
4)Leonardo Da Vinci
5)Benjamin Franklin
6)Mother Theresa
7)Dalai Lama

But then there's my Mum (I assumed family was automatically excluded
though, otherwise she'd replace one of the above) and Thich Nhat
Han...sigh, too hard.:)

Ren
learninginfreedom.com
